TopicTitle: Science Labs "Computer Science" tag is abused

Articles.Content:
Most/all posts tagged "computer science" have nothing to do with it. Renaming it "computing" would sort that out nicely.

Source: Am a computer scientist.

Mostly agree, ['whatever' science] related kind of tag tend to be dumbly egotist or egg autist ( act like a catalyst , ask Ted for ratio xD).

Edited September 19, 2014 by WinkAllKerb''
I don't think I'm able to change it, but I do support it fully. The more we can clean up, the better.

Computer science is so misunderstood. CS is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.

Change to "Computing" ++.

Notice downside also remain:

egotism(+variants) = sharing brake = specialities boost = community boost ?=? equilibrium => endless & andless ratio loop (within source obvious fact => micro pre-planned loop occurence to avoid bigger loop) <= fun=annoying => contrast/unity

This tend to be as clear as a pandora jar in a pokeball glass box. so betwee(i)n "computing" or "computer science" both need there shine time to time. *shrug*

Edited September 20, 2014 by WinkAllKerb''
Did you say: Edit or not to Edit that's the question ...
